page.title: 18Houghton-1937 to 1985
page.content: In 1937 the area was recovering from the great depression & on 12th.May the coronation of King George VI was celebrated.Then the prosperity of the area depended on coal mining which was the major employer.The colliery closed in 1982.In 1937 the town contained many older houses that lacked basic facilities,particularly on the hillside,but post war period by pleasent housing estates rural landscape that then surrounded the town.The town centre has almost been compleatly redeveloped & a new road system created with Sunderland street almost dissapeering.The ancient rectory and grounds have been converted into council offices & park grounds.Life then was very difficult. People worked hard for low wages.
